article_title: Illinois ACA Co-Op Hit With Class Action For Cutting Provider
article_text:
Illinois ACA Co-Op Hit With Class Action For Cutting Provider

Law360, Chicago (February 5, 2016, 6:40 PM ET) -- An Illinois nonprofit insurer created under the Affordable Care Act has been hit with a class action in state court over its decision to boot the University of Chicago from its network of providers after patients had already signed up with the expectation of being attended to by the university’s doctors.



Land of Lincoln Health Inc. — one of the Consumer Oriented and Operated Plans, or co-ops, created under the ACA — dropped the University of Chicago from its network in January after the enrollment period...

To view the full article, register now.
